pageContext.claim: “We said there was a Crisis - the Fake News & the Dems said it was ‘manufactured.’ Now all agree we were right, but they always knew that.”
pageContext.analysis: This is revisionism. The Trump administration in the run-up to the 2018 midterm elections and afterward insisted that the high number of immigrants arriving at the U.S.-Mexico border presented a public safety and national security threat that had reached crisis levels. The phrase "security crisis" was repeatedly invoked. When asked for evidence, Trump administration officials used spurious statistics to claim that terrorists might be arriving at the southern border. That there was a humanitarian crisis at the border was never in question.
